row.entry: References to files are typeset in this style. In this book, these are usually references to configuration templates.
Commands to be executed from the command line are typeset in this style. This is usually a direct or indirect invocation of the pan configuration language compiler.
Pan configuration language keywords are typeset in this style. They represent the language's reserved words and should appear in configuration files exactly as written.

chapter.title: StratusLab Services
chapter.para: Describe all of the services and how they fit together in detail. Provide a detailed view of a cloud deployment and the terminology.
How StratusLab fits into the various cloud service models. It is a IaaS!
Different types of deployments: public, private, community.

chapter.title: Installation Overview
chapter.para: How the installation method works--scripted installation. Other types of installations (e.g. Quattor) not covered here. Manual installation information can be found in GitHub in the service README documents.

section.title: Hardware Requirements
section.para: Hardware requirements for the machines. General need for "fat" machines in a cloud.

section.title: Network Requirements
section.para: Need for range of addresses. Show the ideal layout with three separate VLANs: service control, storage access, and VM network.
Provide an overview of all of the services and their ports.

section.title: Installation Procedure
section.para: Description of general procedure with setting values and then running the installation.

section.title: Storage Service
section.para: The various storage services that are supported. Distinction between physical storage and access to that storage.

section.title: Installation of Cloud Entry Point (CEP)
section.para: Services that run here and their parameters.

section.title: Distributed Database
section.para: Installation of CouchBase. Choice whether this should be installed on CEPs or on VMHs. Can also be installed on separate nodes for very large installations.

section.title: DHCP
section.para: Possibility to setup DHCP automatically. This can also be done by hand on a central server if that is preferred.

section.title: Network Bridge
section.para: Automatic configuration of the network bridge on VMH.

section.title: Marketplace Installation
section.para: Installation of package and configuration of databases for queries.

section.title: Registration Service & LDAP
section.para: Optional services for managing users. Command line tools for user notification, etc.

chapter.title: Running the Cloud
chapter.para: Information on running the cloud as a service.
